												This game is epic for many reasons. For starters, people may buy this game because of its similarity to minecraft, but its much more deserving of that! Terraria has developers that not only keep in contact with its fans, but releases updates regularily (major content patch in ~1 week) and is still considered to be in "beta" stage, as it has so many paths it could follow.Sure, the game might have a small interest for re-playing as a new character, but as i said, its still a beta, and the Devs have confirmed they are working on that problem, this game will return every penny you spend tenfold, with its long game-span, as you start out a a noob and work up to Hell-stone gear. This can be as easy or as hard as you want it to be, with a large community and online resources and options to learn more / tweak the game to you're difficulty (coming soon in 1.0.5).Definate buy!!!<3, Leo :)

												This game, is incredible. I swear, look at my hours. 300+ hours of fun! I still haven't even beaten the game yet after 300 hours... mostly because it is a true challenge. I reccomend this game to hardcore gamers. If you aren't good with hard survival games that can be confusing at the beggining if no videos or people tell you anything about it. AND IT IS NOT ANYTHING LIKE MINECRAFT SO STOP SAYING THAT! Here are some tips throughout the game:First, get wood and make houses so that you and NPCs can live in them. For it to be a valid house, you need to have solid blocks, no  holes in the wall, a table and chair, and a background wall.Next, go mining and exploring. Don't forget to bring torches, NIGHT AND CAVES ARE REALLY DARK WITHOUT LIGHT.You may find cool gadgets that you can equip in your inventory, also, you should make some armor.Next, fight bosses such as the eye of cthulu and get even better gear.You can go and fight skeletron at the end of the world and have access into the dungeon.Keep playing the game and progressing further.Next, go to the bottom of the world, make a long, straight, pathway and then throw a guide voodoo doll into lava and fight the wall of flesh.You will now be in hardmode which makes a new biome and every enemy is buffed incredibley.I will let you continue from there on your own. Have fun :)

number of helpful: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
er 20, 2015
GeneralTerraria is a survival 2D RPG with free content updates, randomly generated worlds, and overall a masterpiece done right. Build, dig, chop, fight and survive are the 5 major elements in Terraria. Enemies that are small, to major bosses, you'll have your hands tied in an experience so great you don't want to stop playing.Terraria has proven to be one of the best 2D survival games for its multiplayer to play with friends, down to the part where it can be very hardcore to master. Terraria also has simple character creation, basically changing the color of your character's hair, body, etc.Building in Terraria is very basic and honestly great at times. Kill bosses to unlock npcs, build traps to protect your home from invasions or master it all with endgame gear. Yes, that's right: gear. Terraria has thousands of items to sell, keep or fight with. If you think you've done it all, re-think that.With a new team re-developing Terraria, they have made the expectations high for Terraria: reworking a lot of in-game features and adding brand new features like fishing or mounts to make you play even longer!My OpinionStill actively developed, Terraria is just one of those overwhelming games, if you've experienced it. Character creation is basic, which why would it be crazy? Half the armor you get in-game will basically cover your character up. Multiplayer is fun  when you play with friends, basically creating great structures, down to owning bosses. Terraria has been one of my favorite, well put together games ever since it released and when it was picked up to be continued via development.Thousands of items to collect, hundreds of bosses to kill, possibly thousands of enemies to conquer, and world changing difficult experiences.Terraria will keep you playing for a long time.OverallI have no complaints. Terraria is a great game overall.Rating: 10/10

content:
26, 2016
												TL; DR: I like this game a lot, but the Multiplayer on it, if you have no friends, is trash.Terraria is a game that, just like Minecraft, is about Survival and Building.The similarities stop there.While Minecraft is focused on Building (Being 3D), Terraria is mostly about the Survival and Discovery, which translates, in-game, to Explore, Get Materials and Progress.I recommend not using a Guide (Asides from the in-game "Guide" NPC), unless you really cannot advance. If you must, search "Terraria Wiki" on google, and read away.It has building as well, some more options than MC offers, including a wider selection of blocks and colors as well. Only things that ruin it, for me, are the lack of NPCs (For huge houses/cities) and the finite world (Get Starbound, if you want to build rather than survive, albeit they are adding hunger next update).The game is flawless, as long as you don't use the Cloud...--Not Affecting GAME Review--As for the community, it's trash, consisting of the Item Trinity, which are people who give items (Usually End-game, therefore ruining the Discovery aspect), which I call "Item Givers", a certain world containing every item in the game (Also destroying "Discovery"), which I call "Item Worlds" and those servers with the equivalent of MC's "/give" command, ruining the Discovery and Exploration aspects; I call those "Item Servers".Basically, if you want Discovery to be at it's max, avoid the "Item Trinity" (Item Giver, Item World and Item Server)....It's also overrun by kiddies who can't even type correctly, let alone play.

content:
ber 12, 2014
												An overall interesting game, the idea of a 2D Minecraft confuses and interests me at the same time since I played the much hated Minecraft for many years before eventually switching over to Steam games in general. There really is not much to say about this game as it is really straight forward, but I'll give it a shot.I would like to start off by saying I have played a limited amount of time with this game and I have limited knowledge of it, so please understand this as you read my review. The first positive thing is the idea of the game. Someone has gone ahead and made a simpler version of MineCraft at a cheaper price (sort of). But honestly, that's also a negative, great idea, but you ripped it off someone...Now onto the actual game, it's frustrating that's for sure, in the 1 hour that I played it I made a good underground house (imo) and I was beginning to like it, then in about the period of 5 minutes I died maybe 5-6 times and my house became ridden with creatures. Certainly not the start I was looking for, but fun to deal with. In the next .7 hours it became apparent that I was a 'noob' the amount of crafting recipes and formulas was never ending, and I realised that this was not a simplified MineCraft, but rather a more advanced Minecraft...There, that's all I learnt from like 1.7 hours of it, do as you please, I sit on the fence.Overall Rating: 7/10

content:
5, 2015
												Terraria is one of the best games I have ever played, there are people out there dense enough to say that it is basically a minecraft copy-off except 2d instead of 3d just because you craft, which is pretty stupid onsidering Terraria has much more diffrent elements in it and crafting is only one of the smaller things you do in the game, thats like saying TF2 is Minecraft because you craft items in it, see what I mean? Aside from that Terraria has over 3000 items in it, bosses, armor, vanity items, items used to customize you character and much more! I definitelty recommend Terraria to anybody any age.10/10.Ok, the review above was written by edgy 13-year old me. I would like to redo this while also being able to have a good laugh about the older one,Terraria is basically a 2D action-adventure sandbox video game developed by Re-Logic. The game has over 3000 items in it by itself. Mods can easily expand and break that barrier with mods such as the Exxo Avalon mod, the N Terraria mod, the Tremor mod, the Necro mod, etc. Obviously for a 10 dollar at max game this is a huge ammount of content to recieve for such a good price, every there are a lot of unique and interesting items in the game and many mechanics, weapons, armor, accessories and block types to explore and have fun with. The game also has 15 bosses and 2 events. The overall item balancing is also pretty solid, it does feel that the gameplay has a certain order to it, but it's so well done and interesting that I do tend to forget about it. Overall the game is fun as hell and a really easy time waster. Got back into it after about a year of NOT playing it and played quite literally 30 hours in 4 days (Exxo Avalon mod, I'm also sick so I can get away with that ♥♥♥♥ :D) go buy it.

content:
9, 2013
Must buy at any price [✓]
Worth the money but wait for a small sale [x]
Wait for a huge discount [x]
Avoid at all costs [x]Terraria, a game that offers tons of things to do, seriously look up how many items exist in this game...This game is reffered by many to "2D Minecraft" , don't let that fool you as this has ALOT more to offer...This game sadly isn't very story based but it's still an amazing experience especially with friends. The Beginning/Pre HardmodeIt starts of pretty slowly and like any survival game, get wood , build stuff to survive and get weapons/armor to survive. This however allows you to start off however you want, try speedrunning to a dungeon to get good items, or start of slowly and nicely and just collect wood and oresThen you'll start getting into the boss fight/even farming some, in Terraria you get a chance of getting 1 of these 2 worlds, the "Crimson" world and the "Corrpution" world. These are quite important but keep in mind they're biomes, they have different items/bosses in the 2 biomes, both are very unique aswell, theres 4 bosses in the beginning of the new world, the Corruption and Crimson biomes both have different bosses but it doesn't change the number of how many you can beat.You'll get to the "Devil of the world" which is called "WoF , Wall Of Flesh" and is the hardest "Pre Hardmode" boss you can get and definately the final one for this mode... Hardmode / End Game After you beat the Wall of Flesh you'll free "The Spirits of the World" and then your Crimson/Corruption will slowly spread across your world, theres going to be a new biome! More enemies / items, MORE BOSSES! And more challenges ahead of you, the game basically does this"Hey player! You just killed the Wall of Flesh! Have this awesome item!"Player:"Thanks! This is easy now!"Terraria"EASY?! Well you're doomed now!"You get 7 more bosses now! Double (Possibly TRIPLE) the items/enemies unlocked and you'll die alot at first, you'll then get Invasion events! You'll get invaded for a whole day in Terraria (Or less if you're OP) and keep dying, those are exciting though as you get items and a non stop fight experience, after you kill all the bosses many players consider it finished but there's more... Expert Mode / Character Levels Expert mode! Basically you start off with Hardmode and then get Expert mode which is double to triple as difficult as Hardmode...so have fun at looking at the "You have died" screen, there's a plus though!Limited to Expert only Items1 "End game boss" <-- considered to manyAnd overall a bigger challengeCharacter levels are something that you get when creating your character and theresSoftcore Mode - On death lose coinsMediumcore Mode - On death lose itemsHardcore Mode - On death you die permanently, gg rip character Servers / Item Servers Servers to play with friends! Easy to set up with Steam and overall good quality for how simple it is (You do get lag spikes if you're on a friends server unless its a LAN) and there's public servers that are amazing! There's actually custom gamemodes made by the community (1 or 2 were staged for multiplayers by devs!)Gamemodes found on servers (Keep in mind not all are listed these are examples)Capture the  DiamondPortal Gun MapsTeam DeathmatchBoss Battle Arenaand alot more!Item servers are a sort of problem of people spawning in items into chests and anyone can take them! Even the Expert mode items which sort of ruins the players/feelings of beating the boss legit but knowing people get those items for free by going on a item server...Keep in mind you don't get somehow banned/ your character deleted if you go on an item server, I haven't heard officialy if servers get put down if they give out free god mode items but I did see some get shut down (Unknown reasons) Mods and Modded Maps You get mods for items and modded maps for challenges / gamemodes (Portal maps /Team Deathmatch maps etc.) Thank you for reading this :) Like I said already this is my longest review / the review I put most time in and I'd like to thank you for reading all of this :)

!! This review will be deleted after revision is made !!Terraria. A 2-Dimensional adventure in a pixelated reality. There isn't a specific objective for this game. (From my experience,) you're free to explore and do whatever you feel should be your goal.My opinions of it all:The GoodIt does have a few elements that remind me of Minecraft, but I wouldn't be one to say that majority of it is so. The soundtrack was nice, pleasant, relaxing. I found my expeditions to the unknown rather amazing; the randomly-generated worlds were astonishing to me upon first site. Those enemies, too. If only I could see more!The BadI don't know anything that I may need to speak of that I would consider bad about this game.OverallI haven't had a lot of experience in this game yet, but I did enjoy what I've been able to do before things happened. After I fix and survive my computer conflicts, I'll have this game another gander and edit this review for farther explanations. I wouldn't necessarily use this review to determine whether (you) want this game or not yet.--Sir Shinigami.

content:
r 8, 2013
												Oh, My Good Friend Terraria...What Can I Say About It? It's Highly Regarded By Me And Many Friends Of Mine. We Play Terraria Constantly. And In Short, We Favor It HIGHLY Over Minecraft. Reasons Are That You Have More Ways To Fight, More Weapons, More Gore (Hellz Yea!), And More Everything Than Minecraft EVER Would Have. Plus, MInecraft Updates Are Tiny And Don't Give ♥♥♥♥. Terraria Updates, While They Takes SOO Much Longer To Come Out, Produce MASSIVE Amounts Of Things That Make The Game SOO Much Better. In Minecraft, It's Diamond Set And You're God, Simple As That. In Terraria, It's So Much More Than That. You Don't Just Become God In Terraria, You Fight For Your Immortality. You Gain And You Seek Out The Loot That Rarely Rarely Drops. You Seek Out More Than Just Diamond Godmode, You Seek Out The Thrill Of Constant Battle, And Risk Yourself, But The Risk Just Adds To The Thrill. Even The Strongest Armor In The Game Doesn't Make You A God, It Just Makes You Harder To Kill. Diamond Armor In Minecraft Is Just A Stupid Godmode For Cowardly Players Who Don't Give Two ♥♥♥♥s About Risk. Plus, Minecraft Is So Much More Costly, For Features That We Don't Really Give Two ♥♥♥♥s About. So In Short, Terraria Outmatches Minecraft In Ways So Numerous, And So Amazing, Nothing Beats Them. Plus, Minecraft's Combat Is Just Poke Poke Poke Poke Ded. Terraria's Combat Is Shooting, Slicing n Dicing, And Spellcasting. Suck On That, Minecraft!

1, 2014
												First and foremost, I don't really like Minecraft. Yup, I said it. And after seeing all the reviews comparing this game to Minecraft, I was completely disinterested. I would've never even played it if my brother hadn't purchased me a copy. For his sake I played it, just so he wouldn't feel like he completely wasted his money. Two months later, I haven't played any other game! Upon my initial playthrough, the obvious similiarities between Terraria and Minecraft were obvious: Collect, craft, build. But it took on a different charm as a 2-D platformer. There is more to do than just craft and build. There are boss fights, events, fighting/maintaining the corruption/crimson/hallow, and numerous NPCs to interact with. You can cxperience the different biomes (forest, snow, swamp, etc), with their own unique creatures and dangers.Bottom line: If you like Minecraft, get it. If you don't like Mincraft, get it. It's a fun game that has a TON of replay value and is just simply fun.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
r 14, 2013
												Many people call Terraria '2D Minecraft'. While that is true in the sense that it has mining, construction, and sandbox aspects, Terraria is so much more. Hundreds of items, swarms of unique enemies, and 'easy to play hard to master' gameplay makes for a very well rounded experience. Don't let the pixelated graphics or the side-scrolling aspect turn you away. The dynamic lighting is very nice. Carrying a torch will light up the area around you. You can throw glow sticks down into caves to see what's ahead. You can even buy a mining helmet, and won't have to worry about carrying a light with you at all! One of the things I found impressive was the way liquids work. Water settles. Lava flows the way one would imagine lava should flow. Want to flood an entire cave? Dig a tunnel from the ocean and let it flow. All in all, Terraria is a spectacular game. It has multiplayer support, and the combat system ties in well with that. The most recent update (1.2) has effectively /doubled/ the saize of an already impressive game. Would recommend to anyone.

er 30, 2015
												Terraria is a Teen rated sandbox sidescroller where you create a charecter, fight monsters, search for supplies, build communities and of course hang with friends. Now when I first played this, I wasen't a noob. (I played it on Xbox)  I knew instantly how to play. Enough bragging about my winnings. It's time to give you what you wan't. This game is well known for it's bosses & minions. It's also known for it's badass level customization. Like...uh. You want to dress up like that alien from Aliens? Well now you can get it & wear it ingame. Some bosses include skeletron, the eater of worlds, eye of cthulhu and the very own twins. Most of these bosses require you to think of a way to trap them, attack them or block them. And now you say...What else is here? I like what I hear.Well timmy, I shall say that last up is the biomes or places.Inside this game there a lots of places for you to visit..such as: Space, Hell, Underground (cave), underwater, juungle, desert and the winter forest. Now this game arouses you, you say? Well. GO BUY IT THEN!

content:
, 2014
												This game is packed full of endless content to experience and gives you an exploration feel to it.This game has these things in it:-Bosses (Pre-Hardmode and Hardmode)  -Challenging, Epic battles that require strategy in order to beat-Different biomes   -Fun to explore, some will really tick you off though like the dungeon or the underground jungle -Crafting -Tons of different weapons and items to equip, there are different crafting stations for different things (F.E Alchemy Station is to craft potions, Anvil's are to craft weapons from different ores)-Some things you can equip on yourself like boots that make you run insanely fast or a shield to prevent knockback-NPC's -I love NPC's in this game, its not like in minecraft where they seem useless, there are multiple NPC's you can get that either sell things, give a service, or give quests to players- You get NPC's by building a house, and meeting certain requirements which is challenging to get them all10/10This game packs many hours into your time and its well worth it, I would go on forever about this game but it probably wouldnt fit in this review! Thanks for reading this :D
